question_title: What will be the value of "ICE BofA High Yield Emerging Markets Corporate Plus Index Option-Adjusted Spread" on 2026-02-12?
summary: Forecasting EM HY corporate credit spread 10 days out from current 3.26%. The spread has been remarkably stable (3.24-3.26%) over the past week. Short time horizon strongly favors stability near current levels. Key risks include tariff uncertainty, but the "TACO" phenomenon (Trump Always Chickens Out) has limited market impact. EM credit outlook is constructive with favorable fundamentals and technicals. Applied slight widening bias for asymmetric risk and mean reversion from near-cyclical-lows. Monte Carlo and scenario analysis suggest median around 3.26% with wider upside tail for potential risk-off events.

factors.description: Recent 5-day stability at 3.24-3.26% range indicates low near-term volatility regime
Very short time horizon (10 days) limits range of possible outcomes - most likely stays near current
Fed held rates steady at Jan 2026 meeting, no policy surprises expected in next 10 days
Constructive EM credit outlook from major asset managers (JPM, AllianzGI, Loomis Sayles)
Tariff uncertainty provides jump risk for sudden widening, though TACO phenomenon has mitigated actual market impact
Near cyclical lows (current 3.26% vs historical low 2.41%) limits tightening potential and creates mean-reversion pressure toward widening
Spreads asymmetric - can widen much faster than they can tighten in stress events
